title: check Boolean expression in for loop

content.question: /** Precondition: bound >= 0 */ public int sum(int bound) { int answer = 0; for (int i = 0; i < bound; i++) { answer += bound; } return answer; } Assume that sum is called with a parameter that satisfies the precondition and that it executes without error. How many times is the test expression i < bound in the for loop header evaluated?
